intro: Succisa pratensis subsp. hirsuta, commonly known as hairy meadow cranesbill, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The subspecies hirsuta is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. This plant is valued for its ornamental qualities and plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
